definition: The age when salmon become sexually mature adults. Influenced by genetics and environment.
definition_source: Van Beveren, E. (2024). Revision of Catch- and Maturity- at Age Used to Assess the Northern Contingent of Atlantic Mackerel (Scomber scombrus). DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2024/012. iv + 28 p.
definition_source_text: Van Beveren, E. (2024). Revision of Catch- and Maturity- at Age Used to Assess the Northern Contingent of Atlantic Mackerel (Scomber scombrus). DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2024/012. iv + 28 p.

term_name: Conservation Unit status-based limit reference point
definition: Stock Management Unit (SMU)-level limit reference points (LRPs) based on the status of component Wild Salmon Policy (WSP) Conservation Units (CUs) recommended to meet requirements of the Fisheries Act.
definition_source: DFO. (2022). Methodologies and Guidelines for Defining Limit Reference Points for Pacific Salmon. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Sci. Advis. Rep. 2022/030. (Erratum: December 2022)
definition_source_text: DFO. (2022). Methodologies and Guidelines for Defining Limit Reference Points for Pacific Salmon. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Sci. Advis. Rep. 2022/030. (Erratum: December 2022)

definition: Expressed as a percentage, the proportion of the total return of adult salmon in a given year that die (harvested or removed) as a result of fishing activity. ER = total fishing mortality / (total fishing mortality + escapement)
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2019). Government of Canada. Pacific Salmon - Glossary. https://www.pac.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/fm-gp/salmon-saumon/gloss-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025]
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2019). Government of Canada. Pacific Salmon - Glossary. https://www.pac.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/fm-gp/salmon-saumon/gloss-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025]
related_terms: Target or limit rate or abundance (subClassOf) [https://w3id.org/dfoc/salmon#TargetOrLimitRateOrAbundance]

term_name: Exploitation rate at Maximum Sustainable Yield
definition: The exploitation rate associated with the maximum sustainable yield (MSY). Usually expressed as an annual proportion. Exploitation rate is synonymous with harvest rate (U).
definition_source: Marentette, J. R., Kronlund, A. R., & Cogliati, K. M. (2021). Specification of Precautionary Approach Reference Points and Harvest Control Rules in Domestically Managed and Assessed Key Harvested Stocks In Canada. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2021/057. vii + 98 p.
definition_source_text: Marentette, J. R., Kronlund, A. R., & Cogliati, K. M. (2021). Specification of Precautionary Approach Reference Points and Harvest Control Rules in Domestically Managed and Assessed Key Harvested Stocks In Canada. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2021/057. vii + 98 p.
related_terms: Target or limit rate or abundance (subClassOf) [https://w3id.org/dfoc/salmon#TargetOrLimitRateOrAbundance]

definition: A benchmark against which the biomass or abundance of the stock or the fishing mortality rate (or exploitation rate) can be measured in order to determine its status. These reference points can be targets, thresholds or limits depending on their intended use.
definition_source: Marentette, J. R., Kronlund, A. R., & Cogliati, K. M. (2021). Specification of Precautionary Approach Reference Points and Harvest Control Rules in Domestically Managed and Assessed Key Harvested Stocks In Canada. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2021/057. vii + 98 p.
definition_source_text: Marentette, J. R., Kronlund, A. R., & Cogliati, K. M. (2021). Specification of Precautionary Approach Reference Points and Harvest Control Rules in Domestically Managed and Assessed Key Harvested Stocks In Canada. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2021/057. vii + 98 p.

definition: Measure of deaths in a stock due to all fishing activities, including: targeted fishing, bycatch and discards, other incidental mortality in other fisheries.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: Index-based management procedures (MPs), in general, adjust the catch based on changes in a population index over time.
definition_source: Huynh, Q.C., Siegle, M.R., and Haggarty, D.R. 2025. Application of the Management Procedure Framework for Outside Quillback Rockfsh (Sebastes maliger ) in British Columbia in 2021. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2024/028. iv + 201 p.
definition_source_text: Huynh, Q.C., Siegle, M.R., and Haggarty, D.R. 2025. Application of the Management Procedure Framework for Outside Quillback Rockfsh (Sebastes maliger ) in British Columbia in 2021. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2024/028. iv + 201 p.

definition: A derived assessment index used in Fisheries Science Reports or stock status reporting.

A fish stock experiencing serious harm may be depleted to the point where it has impaired productivity or reproductive capacity. As a result, the stock would be less resilient to fishing and could not easily rebuild. Serious harm may be irreversible, or only slowly reversible over the long-term, and can be due to fishing, other human-induced impacts, or natural causes. Under the Precautionary Approach policy and the Fish Stocks Provisions (FSPs), breaching the LRP is a trigger for a rebuilding plan.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: Marine survival is defined as the portion of the coded-wire tagged smolt release that has survived to be either caught in marine fisheries or returned to freshwater as adult.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2025). 2024 Marine Survival Forecast of Southern British Columbia Coho. 17 p.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2025). 2024 Marine Survival Forecast of Southern British Columbia Coho. 17 p.

definition: The largest catch (yield) that can be taken on average from a population under existing environmental conditions. Catch will vary annually due to variation in a populations survival rate.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.
related_terms: Target or limit rate or abundance (subClassOf) [https://w3id.org/dfoc/salmon#TargetOrLimitRateOrAbundance]

definition: A measurement datum representing an empirically observed rate, count, or abundance derived from monitoring or survey data.

Percent of salmon spawning in the natural environment that were reared in a hatchery and are first generation hatchery fish. Contrast with Natural origin spawners (not reared in a hatchery, but could be second generation hatchery) or wild salmon with no hatchery lineage.
definition_source: Pacific Marine Conservation Caucus, Salmon Subcommittee. (2022). Mark Selective Fisheries and Mass Marking under the Pacific Salmon Strategy Initiative: Comments and Feedback on Proposed Expansion. Pacific Marine Conservation Caucus Salmon Subcommittee. Available at https://www.mccpacific.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/MCC-Salmon-Subcommittee-Comments-on-DFOs-MM-and-MSF-Discussion-Paper-220930.pdf.
definition_source_text: Pacific Marine Conservation Caucus, Salmon Subcommittee. (2022). Mark Selective Fisheries and Mass Marking under the Pacific Salmon Strategy Initiative: Comments and Feedback on Proposed Expansion. Pacific Marine Conservation Caucus Salmon Subcommittee. Available at https://www.mccpacific.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/MCC-Salmon-Subcommittee-Comments-on-DFOs-MM-and-MSF-Discussion-Paper-220930.pdf.

definition: Reference points are used as targets to achieve or as limits to avoid.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to stock assessment. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/module-1/11-eng.html [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to stock assessment. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/module-1/11-eng.html [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: The ratio of all human induced removals and total exploitable stock size.
definition_source: Forrest, R. E., Holt, K. R., & Kronlund, A. R. (2018). Performance of alternative harvest control rules for two Pacific groundfish stocks with uncertain natural mortality: Bias, robustness and trade-offs. Fisheries Research, 206, p. 259-286.
definition_source_text: Forrest, R. E., Holt, K. R., & Kronlund, A. R. (2018). Performance of alternative harvest control rules for two Pacific groundfish stocks with uncertain natural mortality: Bias, robustness and trade-offs. Fisheries Research, 206, p. 259-286.

definition: Removal reference is the maximum removal rate of a fish stock. It is less than or equal to the stock's maximum sustainable yield. It can be expressed in terms of fishing mortality, harvest rate, and fishing effort.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
related_terms: Target or limit rate or abundance (subClassOf) [https://w3id.org/dfoc/salmon#TargetOrLimitRateOrAbundance]

term_name: Spawning biomass at Maximum Sustainable Yield
definition: The predicted number of spawners producing maximum sustained yield. It is a key biological reference point used in fisheries management and benchmark under the Wild Salmon Policy to maintain fish populations at sustainable levels.
definition_source: Parken, C. K., McNicol, R. E., & Irvine, J. R. (2006). Habitat-based methods to estimate escapement goals for data limited Chinook salmon stocks in British Columbia, 2004. Canadian Science Advisory Secretariat Research Document 2006/083. Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.
definition_source_text: Parken, C. K., McNicol, R. E., & Irvine, J. R. (2006). Habitat-based methods to estimate escapement goals for data limited Chinook salmon stocks in British Columbia, 2004. Canadian Science Advisory Secretariat Research Document 2006/083. Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.
related_terms: Target or limit rate or abundance (subClassOf) [https://w3id.org/dfoc/salmon#TargetOrLimitRateOrAbundance]

definition: Spawner abundance that will result in recovery to SMSY in one generation in the absence of fishing under equilibrium conditions.
definition_source: Holt, C. A. (2009). Evaluation of benchmarks for conservation units in Canada’s Wild Salmon Policy: Technical Documentation. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2009/059. x + 50 p.
definition_source_text: Holt, C. A. (2009). Evaluation of benchmarks for conservation units in Canada’s Wild Salmon Policy: Technical Documentation. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Res. Doc. 2009/059. x + 50 p.
related_terms: Target or limit rate or abundance (subClassOf) [https://w3id.org/dfoc/salmon#TargetOrLimitRateOrAbundance]

term_name: Target or limit rate or abundance
definition: A value specification representing a policy- or model-defined target or limit, such as TAC, UMSY, or reference points.
The overall stock level target. It is determined by setting productivity, broader ecological, and socio-economic objectives for the fishery. It is typically set at or above the USR.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to stock assessment. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/module-1/11-eng.html [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to stock assessment. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/module-1/11-eng.html [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: A policy-defined catch limit set for a particular fishery within a specified management period. Also referred to as quota.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
related_terms: Target or limit rate or abundance (subClassOf) [https://w3id.org/dfoc/salmon#TargetOrLimitRateOrAbundance]

definition: A threshold below which fishing must be reduced to avoid reaching the LRP. The USR must be set at an appropriate distance above the LRP to provide sufficient opportunity for managers to recognize a declining stock status and sufficient time for management actions to take effect.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
